decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Time Limit
The development hereby permitted shall begin no later than three years from the date of planning permission P/2021/1736, dated: 21/09/2021.
Reason: To accord with the provisions of Section 92 (1) of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.
Condition : 2 - In Accordance with Approved Drawings
The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in this application and the plans submitted (Received: 28/06/2021: TP(01)01 Rev: B Site Location Plan; TP(01)02 Rev: B Existing Block Plan; TP(01)03 Rev: B Proposed Block Plan; TP(01)04 Rev: B Existing Site Plan; TP(01)05 Rev: B Proposed Site Plan; TP(10)20 Rev: B Proposed Ground Floor Plan; TP(10)21 Rev: B Proposed First Floor Plan; TP(10)22 Rev: B Proposed Second Floor Plan; TP(11)01 Rev: B Existing Elevations; TP(11)20 Rev: B Proposed East Elevation; TP(11)21 Rev: B Proposed North Elevation; TP(12)20 Rev: B Proposed Section AA; TP(12)21 Rev: B Proposed Section BB; TP(12)23 Rev: B Proposed West Elevation; Planning Statement - Dated June 2021; Design and Access Statement; Tree Report - Dated 27th April 2021; 21-034 � Drainage Strategy Technical Note - Dated April 2021. Received: 09/08/2021: Transport Statement - Dated September 2019; SK05 Bike Store Plan. Received: 17/08/2021: SK002 Overlooking Distances; SK003 Amenity Area; SK004 Density Comparisons; SK005 Bulk Comparisons; Rapid Health Impact Assessment Dated August 2021. Received: 26/08/2021: Energy and Sustainability Statement (Rev B) dated 25/08/2021; TP(12)22 Rev: C Proposed South Elevation; TP(10)23 Rev: C Proposed Roof Plan.) Therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.
Reason: To ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission, a satisfactory standard of development is secured and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme.
Condition : 3 - Hours of Construction
No demolition or construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8:00am to 6:00pm on Mondays to Friday and 9:00am to 1:00pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and Public Holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason:  In order to safeguard the amenities of adjoining residential properties and to ensure that the proposed development does not prejudice the amenities of the locality in accordance with policies CC1 Context and character, CC2 Urban design and architecture and EQ5 Noise of the adopted Local Plan.
Condition : 4 - Permitted Development Rights Restriction
Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 2015 (as amended) (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order), no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings/enclosures within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out without prior written approval of the Local Planning Authority.
Reason: In order not to prejudice the amenities of the adjoining properties and in order that the Local Planning Authority is able to exercise control over future development of the site in accordance with Local Plan Policies SC7, CC1 and CC2.
Condition : 5 - Materials of External Surfaces
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2023/1187, approved on 14/06/2023. 
Reason:  In order that the Council may be satisfied as to the details of the development in the interests of the visual amenity of the area and to satisfy the requirements of policies CC1 Context and character and CC2 Urban Design and Architecture of the adopted Local Plan.
Condition : 6 - Cycle Parking
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/0412, approved on 13/06/2024. 
The cycle stores shall be made available to occupants upon first occupation of the hereby approved development and maintained as such thereafter without obstruction. 
Reason: To ensure that secure cycle spaces are provided and retained for the occupiers of the residential units, in accordance with Local Plan Policy EC2 and London Plan Policy T2.
Condition : 7 - EV Charging Points
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/0136, approved on 21/03/2024. 
The charging points shall be installed in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the approved development and so maintained at all times thereafter.
Reason:  To support sustainable transport objectives in accordance with Adopted Local Plan Policy EC2 and Local Plan Policy T6.
Condition : 8 - Construction Management and Logistics Plan
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2023/0652, approved on 03/05/2023.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of neighbours and Highway Safety is maintained and preserved in accordance with Policies CC2, EQ5 and EC2 of the Local Plan and London Plan Policy T7.
Condition : 9 - Water Consumption 
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/1201, approved on 07/08/2024. 
Reason: In order to protect and conserve water supplies and resources in accordance with London Plan Policy SI5 and the London Borough of Hounslow Local Plan Policy EQ2. 
Condition : 10 - Sustainable Materials
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/0136, approved on 21/03/2024. 
Reason: In order to ensure the sustainable sourcing of materials in accordance with the London Plan Policy SI2 and the Mayor of London's Sustainable Design and Construction SPG. 
Condition : 11 - Waste and Recycling Storage
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/0412, approved on 13/06/2024 and The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details.
Reason: To ensure adequate provision for waste and recycling in accordance with Local Plan Policy EQ7.
Condition : 12 - Drainage Details
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2023/1185, approved on 30/06/2023. 
The development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details prior to the first occupation of the buildings approved.
Reason: To prevent the risk of flooding to and from the site, in accordance with relevant policy requirements including but not limited to London Plan policies SI12 and SI13 (and its associated Sustainable Design and Construction SPG), the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems and Local Plan policy EQ3.
Condition : 13 - Drainage � Implementation Confirmation
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/3146, approved on 24/12/2024.
The sustainable drainage scheme shall be managed and maintained thereafter in accordance with the agreed management and maintenance plan for all of the proposed drainage components.
Reason: To ensure that the methods to mitigate the risk of surface water flooding have been implemented as agreed and that the drainage system is suitably managed, in accordance with the Non-Statutory Technical Standards for Sustainable Drainage Systems, the National Planning Policy Framework (Paragraph 103), London Plan policies SI12 and SI13 (together with associated guidance to these policies) and Local Plan policy EQ3.
Condition : 14 - Hard and Soft Landscaping (and Play Area)
A) The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/0136, approved on 21/03/2024. Development shall thereafter be carried out in accordance with the approved details and maintained in accordance with such thereafter.
B) Any trees or plants that, within 5 years of planting, die, are cut down, uprooted, destroyed or become (in the opinion of the Local Planning Authority) seriously damaged or defective, shall be replaced with another tree or plant of the same size and species within the first planting season following its death, removal, uprooting or destruction, unless the Local Planning Authority gives its prior written approval to any variation. 
Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the area and to promote biodiversity, in accordance with Local Plan policies CC1 and GB7 and London Plan policies G6 and G7.
Condition : 15 - Boundary Treatment
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2023/0848, approved on 14/06/2023, and maintained thereafter in accordance with the approved details.
Reason:  To safeguard the visual amenities of the locality and privacy of adjoining properties in accordance with policies  CC1 Context and character and CC2 Urban design and architecture of the adopted Local Plan.
Condition : 16 - Parking
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/0136, approved on 21/03/2024 and shall be constructed and available for use before first occupation of any part of the development and such spaces shall not be used for any other purposes. 
Reason: In order to prevent obstruction and inconvenience to users of the adjacent highway and the premises, and in the interests of road safety in accordance with policies CC1 Context and character, CC2 Urban design and architecture and EC2 Developing a sustainable local transport network of the adopted Local Plan.
Condition : 17 - External Lighting Strategy 
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2024/0708, approved on 25/04/2024 and Development shall thereafter be carried out and maintained thereafter in accordance with the approved strategy.
Reason: In order that the Council may be satisfied with the external lighting for reasons of external appearance and design quality; and to prevent unacceptable light spill and disturbance to neighbouring residents or impact the neighbouring Site of Importance for Nature Conservation in accordance with Local Plan Policies CC2, EQ6 and GB7.
Condition : 18 - Tree Protection 
A scheme for the protection of trees, in accordance with BS5837:2012, shall be carried out in accordance with the drawings/report numbered Tree Report - Dated 27th April 2021, received: 28/06/2021. he scheme shall secure and facilitate implementation on site of: 
a) Tree Protection Barriers in accordance with the details and positions shown on the approved drawings referred in this condition. The Tree Protection Barriers must be erected prior to each phase of construction commencing and remain in place, and undamaged for the duration of that phase. No works shall take place on the next phase until the Tree Protection Barriers are repositioned for that phase. 
b) The erection of fencing for the protection of any retained tree or hedge shall be carried out in complete accordance with BS5837:2012 and the details approved as specified on the drawings referred to in this condition, before any equipment, machinery, or materials are brought onto the site for the purposes of development or other operations. 
Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to ensure that the retention of the maximum number of trees on the site and their protection from damage in the interests of biodiversity and visual amenity of the area, and to accord with policies CC1, CC2 and GB7 of th e adopted Local Plan
Condition : 19 - Ecological Assessment and Mitigation 
The development shall be carried out in strict compliance with the details approved under application P/2023/0996, approved on 02/06/2023 and development shall thereafter be completed in accordance with the approved details, including the implementation of any mitigation measures required, and maintained as such thereafter.
Reason: The site borders a Site of Importance for Nature Conservation and to ensure that the development does not result in significant adverse impact on biodiversity without mitigation or compensation in accordance with Local Plan Policy GB7.
Condition : 20 - Energy and Sustainability Statement
The hereby approved development shall be carried out in full accordance with the approved Energy and Sustainability Statement (Rev B) dated 25/08/2021 and received on 26/08/2021.
Reason: To enable the Local Planning Authority to ensure that the retention of the maximum number of trees on the site and their protection from damage in the interests of biodiversity and visual amenity of the area, and to accord with policies CC1, CC2 and GB7 of the adopted Local
Condition : 21 - Carbon Offset Fund 
The Carbon Offset Fund has been paid, which has been confirmed under application P/2024/3146, approved on 24/12/2024
Reason: To ensure the development meets sustainability standards in accordance with London Plan Policy SI2 and Local Plan Policy EQ1.
Condition : 22 - Solar PV Panels
The Solar PV panels to be installed shall be of a specification that includes antiglare technology. The development shall thereafter be maintained as such in perpetuity.
Reason: To avoid unacceptable levels of glare adversely affecting the amenities of neighbouring residents in accordance with Local Plan Policy CC2.
description: Removal of condition 9 and 22 (low / zero carbon) following planning permission P/2021/2631 dated 21/09/2021 for the Erection of four new terraced houses comprising of three, two-storey two-bedroom houses and one, three-storey three-bedroom house with associated cycle, car parking and play area.
